messages.speech: Your salaries will be calibrated against those of the market (e.g., the Big 4) and the company you are joining. For those pursuing a finance path, this is more predictable. For those following a generalist track it is not as straightforward.

Indeed, it's conceivable that you may even have to take a temporary step backwards in order to move forwards. However, it's important to balance off all aspects of the scheme and career opportunities - not just $. However, once you have completed your 3 years+ training, you will be paid the market rate for that role.
